mcq_data.question: Which part of the CPU performs calculations and logical operations?
mcq_data.solution: The ALU (Arithmetic Logic Unit) performs calculations and logical operations.

mcq_data.question: RAM is a type of ____ memory.
mcq_data.solution: RAM is volatile memory because it loses data when the power is off.

mcq_data.question: Which of the following is an example of an input device?
mcq_data.solution: A keyboard is an input device used to enter data into a computer.

mcq_data.question: Which component of the CPU directs the flow of data and instructions?
mcq_data.solution: The Control Unit directs the flow of data and instructions in the CPU.

mcq_data.question: Which of these is an output device?
mcq_data.solution: A monitor is an output device that displays information.

mcq_data.question: What does RAM stand for?
mcq_data.solution: RAM stands for Random Access Memory.

mcq_data.question: Which type of memory is the fastest?
mcq_data.solution: Cache memory is the fastest type of memory in a computer.

mcq_data.question: Which of the following stores data permanently?
mcq_data.solution: ROM (Read Only Memory) stores data permanently.

mcq_data.question: Which of the following is an example of an output device?
mcq_data.solution: A printer is an output device that produces a hard copy of digital data.

mcq_data.question: The speed of the CPU is measured in:
mcq_data.solution: The speed of the CPU is measured in Hertz (cycles per second).
